page.title: 01CLEVELANDS WILD MOORLAND
page.content: The bleak grouse moors of Battersby, Ingleby and Baysdale present a haunting landscape as they skirt the Cleveland Hills, south of Kildale. Sheep roam the heather, disturbed only by walkers tackling this section of the Cleveland Way. Inhospitable in Winter, breathtaking in Summer, the rugged moorland stretches south to the horizon, the contours only broken by huge boulders and ancient dry stone walls, long neglected. The relative fertility of Baysdale is a contrast. A few farms into the valley, made more verdant by the trickling beck. Cows graze the steep fields of rough pastureland, chickens roam freely and farm dogs bark in warning. Thick woodland provides the backbone of the area, conifers and deciduous trees intermingled in a cool forest that protects its plentiful wildlife.
